The icon to use with the message.
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default Dwc icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:

description.value:
`<dwc-app-layout>` is a responsive layout component that provides a header, a footer, a drawer, and content.
The header and footer are fixed, the drawer slides in and out of the viewport, and the content is scrollable.

This component can be used to build common application layouts, such as a dashboard.

attributes.name: drawer-breakpoint
attributes.description:
A media query to control when the drawer will be switched to popover mode.

Useful for small screens. By default the drawer popover mode will be enabled
when the screen size is `800px` or less.

attributes.name: drawer-footer-visible
attributes.description: When true, the drawer will show the footer section.

attributes.name: drawer-header-visible
attributes.description: When true, the drawer will show the header section.

attributes.name: drawer-opened
attributes.description: When true, the drawer is opened, otherwise it is closed.

attributes.name: drawer-overlay
attributes.description: When true and the `drawerPopover` is enabled, the drawer will have an overlay behind it when it is opened.

attributes.name: drawer-placement
attributes.description: The drawer position.

attributes.name: drawer-popover
attributes.description: When true, the drawer will pop over the header, footer and the content area.

attributes.name: fit-viewport
attributes.description:
When true, the content area will fill the viewport height, otherwise the content area will be scrollable.

When setting this property to `true` you should make the `html` and `body` elements
non-scrollable.

attributes.name: footer-fixed
attributes.description: When true, the footer will be fixed at the top and won't move when the user scrolls.

attributes.name: footer-offscreen
attributes.description: When true, the footer position will be shifted to fit beside the opened drawer.

attributes.name: footer-reveal
attributes.description: When true, the footer will be revealed when the user scrolls up and hidden when scrolls down.

attributes.name: footer-shadow
attributes.description:
When set to `scroll`, the footer will have a shadow after revealing.
When set to `always`, the shadow will always be visible, otherwise, it's hidden.

attributes.name: header-fixed
attributes.description: When true, the header will be fixed at the top and won't move when the user scrolls.

attributes.name: header-offscreen
attributes.description: When true, the header position will be shifted to fit beside the opened drawer.

attributes.name: header-reveal
attributes.description: When true, the header will be revealed when the user scrolls up and hidden when scrolls down.

attributes.name: header-shadow
attributes.description:
When set to `scroll`, the header will have a shadow after revealing.
Alternatively, when set to `always`, the shadow will always be visible; otherwise, it remains hidden.

description.value:
The `<dwc-backdrop>` is a full-screen component that overlays other components. It can be used to
block user interaction with other components, and emphasizes the busy state.

attributes.name: visible
attributes.description: When true, the backdrop will be visible and opened; otherwise, it is hidden.

attributes.description:
Typing into the list accumulates keystrokes entered within a specified number of milliseconds into a typeahead
buffer. This allows the user, for example, to jump directly to New York in a list of all 50 states
by typing "NY". Without this typeahead buffer, the user would have to press "N" eight times to skip
past the other state codes beginning with "N."

The default time window for this feature is 1000 milliseconds (1 second)

description.value:
The `{{CONTROL_NAME}}<dwc-dialog>` creates a {{CONTROL_NAME_WITH_LINK}} dialog box.

{{#eq CONTROL_NAME "MSGBOX"}}
 **Syntax:** `MSGBOX(str1{,expr{,str2{,button1{,button2{,button3}}}}}{,MODE="options"}{,TIM=int}{,ERR=lineref})`

 ```bbj
   selected = msgbox("This is the message", 0, "MessageBox", mode="blurred=true,button-0-theme=gray")
 ```

Each attribute listed in the table below can be passed to the `MSGBOX` dialog using the `MODE` option.
For example, `mode="blurred=true"` will set the dialog to be blurred.

The `MSGBOX` dialog uses `BBjButton<dwc-button>` to render the buttons. Any supported [`BBjButton<dwc-button>`](dwc/BBjButton.md) attributes can
also be passed to the `MSGBOX` function using the `MODE` option. In this case, the attribute must be prefixed with `button-` followed by the button
index (starting from 0). For example, `button-0-theme=gray` will set the first button theme to `gray`.

{{/eq}}

{{#eq CONTROL_NAME "PROMPT"}}
 **Syntax:** `PROMPT(message{,default{,title{,expr}}}{,MODE="options"}{,TIM=int}{,ERR=lineref})`

```bbj
  password$ = prompt("Enter your password","","Credentials Required",0, mode="input-type=PASSWORD,blurred=true,button-0-theme=gray")
```
Each attribute listed in the table below can be passed to the `PROMPT` dialog using the `MODE` option. For example, `mode="blurred=true"` will set the
dialog to be blurred.

The `PROMPT` dialog uses [`BBjButton<dwc-button>`](dwc/BBjButton.md) to render the buttons and
[`BBjEditBox<dwc-field>`](dwc/BBjEditBox.md) to render the input. Any supported [`BBjButton<dwc-button>`](dwc/BBjButton.md) attributes can also be
passed to the `PROMPT` function using the `MODE` option. In this case, the attribute must be prefixed with `button-` followed by the button index
(starting from 0). For example, `button-0-theme=gray` will set the first button theme to `gray`. The same applies to the input box. Any supported
[`BBjEditBox<dwc-field>`](dwc/BBjEditBox.md) attributes can be passed to the `PROMPT` function using the `MODE` option. In this case, the attribute
must be prefixed with `input-`. For example, `input-type=PASSWORD` will set the input type to `password`.

{{/eq}}

When the media query matches, the dialog will be full-screen, otherwise it will be positioned.

attributes.description:
Typing into the list accumulates keystrokes entered within a specified number of milliseconds into a 'typeahead'
buffer. This allows the user to, for example, jump directly to New York in a list of all 50 states
by typing "NY". Without this 'typeahead' buffer, the user would have to press "N" eight times to skip
past the other state codes beginning with "N."

The default time window for this feature is 1000 milliseconds (1 second).

description.value:
The `<dwc-icon>` provides methods for displaying a UI icon.

An icon is a nonselectable SVG image that represents an application, a capability, or some other concept or
specific entity with meaning for the user.

BBj does not bundle an icons library by default. but it configure several icons pools that the user can choose from.
Then the icons will be loaded from a CDN on demand.


## Configured Pools

BBj configures the following list of pools which can be used with `dwc-icon`

1. [Tabler](https://tabler-icons.io/)
2. [Feather](https://feathericons.com/)
3. [fa (Font Awesome Free)](https://fontawesome.com/)
4. and `Dwc` which is a small subset of Tabler Icons


## Usage

You can use this component like this:

```html
<dwc-icon pool="POOL_NAME" name="ICON_NAME"></dwc-icon>
```

?> **Note:**: The default pool name is `tabler`

### Custom Pools

You can register additional pools to use with `dwc-icon`.

```javascript
(window.Dwc ??= {}).IconsPools ??= [];
window.Dwc.IconsPools.push({
  name: 'POOL_NAME',
  resolver: name => {return 'SVG_URL'}
});
````

For instance , This is how the [feather pool](https://feathericons.com/) is registered.
```javascript
(window.Dwc ??= {}).IconsPools ??= [];
window.Dwc.IconsPools.push({
  name: 'feather',
  resolver: name => `https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/feather-icons@4.28.0/dist/icons/${name}.svg`
});
````

Then in your code

```html
<dwc-icon pool="feather" name="activity"></dwc-icon>
```

## DWC Pool

All used icons in Dwc components use the `dwc` pool , You can override the pool like this:

``` javascript
const DwcIcons = {
'calendar': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-calendar" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <rect x="4" y="5" width="16" height="16" rx="2"/> <line x1="16" y1="3" x2="16" y2="7"/> <line x1="8" y1="3" x2="8" y2="7"/> <line x1="4" y1="11" x2="20" y2="11"/> <line x1="11" y1="15" x2="12" y2="15"/> <line x1="12" y1="15" x2="12" y2="18"/></svg>`,
'check': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-check" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <path d="M5 12l5 5l10 -10"/></svg>`,
'chevron-down': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-down" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="6 9 12 15 18 9"/></svg>`,
'chevron-left': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-left" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="15 6 9 12 15 18"/></svg>`,
'chevron-right': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-right" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="9 6 15 12 9 18"/></svg>`,
'chevron-up': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevron-up" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"> <path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"/> <polyline points="6 15 12 9 18 15"/></svg>`,
'chevrons-left': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevrons-left" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"></path><polyline points="11 7 6 12 11 17"></polyline><polyline points="17 7 12 12 17 17"></polyline></svg>`,
'chevrons-right': `<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" class="icon icon-tabler icon-tabler-chevrons-right" width="24" height="24" viewBox="0 0 24 24" stroke-width="2" stroke="currentColor" fill="none" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round"><path stroke="none" d="M0 0h24v24H0z" fill="none"></path><polyline points="7 7 12 12 7 17"></polyline><polyline points="13 7 18 12 13 17"></polyline></svg>`,
```

description.value:
The `<dwc-icon-button>` provides methods for displaying a UI icon button.

An icon button is an selectable SVG image that represents a capability, or some other concept or
specific entity with meaning for the user.

description.value: `BBjInfiniteScroll<dwc-infinite-scroll>` Loads content continuously as the user scrolls down, eliminating the need for pagination.

attributes.name: completed
attributes.description: When true, the component will not ask to load any more items.

attributes.name: icon
attributes.description:
The refresh icon to use when loading more data. The icon can be in any of the following formats:
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default Dwc icons pool. (ex: `folder`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:folder`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'spinner'}
    2. {pool: 'feather' name: 'spinner}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: When true, the component is loading.

attributes.name: root
attributes.description: The element that is used as the viewport. Must be the ancestor of the `dwc-infinite-scroll` or null.

attributes.name: text
attributes.description: The instructions string

description.value: The `BBjListBox<dwc-listbox>` provides methods for manipulating a UI listbox control.

attributes.name: allow-deselection
attributes.description: When true, clicking on a selected item will deselect it.

attributes.name: auto-validate
attributes.description: When true, the control will be validated with every change.

attributes.name: auto-validate-on-load
attributes.description: When true, the control will be validated when it is loaded for the first time.

attributes.name: auto-was-validated
attributes.description: When true, the control will switch the `valid` property automatically after the control is validated and became valid.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: Specifies that the list should be disabled.

attributes.name: expanse
attributes.description: The component's expanse

attributes.name: has-focus
attributes.description: When true, the list has focus; otherwise it is blurred.

attributes.name: helper-text
attributes.description: The component's helper text.

attributes.name: invalid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is invalid.

attributes.name: invalid-message
attributes.description: An error message to present to the user when the control is invalid.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: The list label

attributes.name: multi-selection
attributes.description: When true, enables multi-selection, otherwise, single selection is selected.

attributes.name: multi-selection-by-click
attributes.description: When true and multi-selection is enabled, the user will be able to select and deselect items by clicking.

attributes.name: readonly
attributes.description: When true, puts the control in readonly mode

attributes.name: renderer
attributes.description: A BBj expression or a function to render the list item's label.

attributes.name: tab-traversable
attributes.description: Indicates that the element can be focused. A negative value means that the element is not reachable via sequential keyboard navigation.

attributes.name: tick-mark
attributes.description: When true, the selected item will have a check icon instead of being highlighted.

attributes.name: type-to-select
attributes.description: Enables or disables the type to select feature.

attributes.name: type-to-select-case-sensitive
attributes.description: When true, the search performed by typeToSelect feature will be case sensitive.

attributes.name: type-to-select-timeout
attributes.description:
Typing into the list accumulates keystrokes entered within a specified number of milliseconds into a typeahead
buffer. This allows the user, for example, to jump directly to New York in a list of all 50 states
by typing "NY". Without this typeahead buffer, the user would have to press "N" eight times to skip
past the other state codes beginning with "N."

The default time window for this feature is 1000 milliseconds (1 second).

attributes.name: valid
attributes.description: Set to true to indicate that the user input is valid.

attributes.name: validation-icon
attributes.description:
The icon to use with the validation message
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default Dwc icons pool. (ex: `x`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:x`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'x'}
    2. {pool: 'feather', name: 'x'}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

attributes.name: validation-popover-distance
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the validation message away from the control.

attributes.name: validation-popover-placement
attributes.description: Describes the preferred placement of the validation message.

attributes.name: validation-popover-skidding
attributes.description: The distance in pixels from which to offset the validation message along the control.

attributes.name: validation-style
attributes.description: When `popover`, the invalid message will be displayed as a popover, as an inline message otherwise.

attributes.name: validator
attributes.description:
A Javascript expression or function to validate the control. If the expression has the 'return' keyword in it, then it is used as is; if not, then wrap it with `return` and ';' to make a function. The expression has access to the following parameters:
  1. `value`: The control's
  2. `x`: Alias for value
  3. `text`: For consistency with the legacy control and form validation APIs, same as `value`
  4. `component`: The instance of the client component
  5. `control`: Alias for component

When true then the hotkey's label will be hidden, visible otherwise.
Setting this property will affect the top-level dropdown items only.

Describes the dropdown items placement.
Setting this property will affect the top-level dropdown items only.

attributes.description: The value to add to the current scroll position when the right or the left advancer is clicked.

attributes.description:
The distance in pixels from which to offset the dropdown items along the menubar.
Setting this property will affect the top-level dropdown items only.

description.value: The `{{CONTROL_NAME}}<dwc-menuitem>` provides methods for manipulating a UI menu item control.

attributes.description: When true, the item's checked status can be changed by the user, false otherwise.

attributes.description: When true, the item is checked, unchecked otherwise.

attributes.description: Specifies that the control should be disabled.

attributes.description: If dropdown item then the distance in pixels to offset the menu away from its item.

attributes.description: When true, the item is a dropdown menu , normal item otherwise. The component will automatically update this property when the menu slot is available.

The component's expanse.

attributes.description: When true, the control has focus , blurred otherwise. The component will automatically update this value

attributes.description: Assigns the hotkey to a specific target element.

attributes.name: label
attributes.description: Specifies a short label for the control.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: If dropdown item and opened then true, false otherwise.

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: Describes the dropdown menu position. Setting this property won't affect the item's menus' dropdown items.

attributes.name: skidding
attributes.description: If dropdown item then the distance in pixels to offset the menu along its item.

attributes.name: tab-traversable
attributes.description: Indicates that the element can be focused. A negative value means that the element is not reachable via sequential keyboard navigation.

attributes.name: theme
attributes.description: The theme name. Setting this property will NOT update the item's menu's theme if the item is a dropdown item

description.value:
The `BBjNavigator/<dwc-navigator>` provides methods for manipulating a UI navigator control.

## Text Expressions

All text properties `textFirst` , `textFirst` , `textLast` , `textPage` , ... are evaluated as Javascript expressions.
The text expression is evaluated with the following parameters:

- `component`: The current component instance.
- `control`: Alias for `component`.
- `current`: The current page number.
- `x`: Alias for `current`.
-  `startIndex`: The start index of the current page.
- `endIndex`: The end index of the current page.
- `startPage`: The index of the first page
- `endPage`: The index of the last page
- `totalPages`: The total number of pages.
- `totalItems`:The total number of items.

For instance


attributes.name: mask-rounding
attributes.description:
When the control is programmatically set to a value that
exceeds the mask precision, the value is truncated, not rounded. For example, if the mask
is "###,###,##0.00-", then programmatically setting the control value to -12345.6789 will
cause it to display "12,345.67-", the same value that it would show if the user attempted
to type those characters directly into the control.
This differs from the standard Numeric Output rules, which would round to "12,345.68-".
Setting this attribute to "TRUE" will cause the
input to round values that exceed the mask precision, consistent with standard numeric output rules.

attributes.name: name
attributes.description:
The radio button name

A radio group is defined by giving each of radio buttons in the group the same name. Once a radio group is established, selecting any radio button in that group automatically deselects any currently-selected radio button in the same group.

You can have as many radio groups on a page as you like, as long as each has its own unique name.

For example, if your form needs to ask the user for their preferred contact method, you might create three radio buttons, each with the name property set to contact but one with the value email, one with the value phone, and one with the value mail.

The user never sees the value or the name unless you expressly add code to display it.

description.value:
`BBjPullToRefresh<dwc-refresher>` lets a user pull down on a container using
touch in order to refresh or retrieve more data.

Pull-to-refresh is widely used on devices with a touch screen.
You can use the APIs shown here to implement pull-to-refresh in your app.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: When true,  the refresher will be disabled, enabled otherwise

attributes.name: icon-arrow
attributes.description:
The arrow icon to use when the `stage` is `pull` or `release`. The icon can be in any of the following formats:
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default Dwc icons pool. (ex: `folder`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:folder`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'arrow'}
    2. {pool: 'feather' name: 'arrow}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

attributes.name: icon-refresh
attributes.description:
The refresh icon to use when the `stage` is `refresh`. The icon can be in any of the following formats:
  1. URL: (ex: /path/to/image.png)
  2. Data URL: (ex: data:image/jpeg;base64,/9j/4SDpRXhpZgAAT....)
  3. ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the default Dwc icons pool. (ex: `folder`)
  4. POOL_NAME:ICON_NAME: An icon to load from the passed pool. (ex: `feather:folder`)
  5. An object which provides all the required properties to build the icon. for instance:
    1. {name: 'spinner'}
    2. {pool: 'feather' name: 'spinner}
    3. {src: 'image/path'}

description.value:
A streamlined Table component designed for rendering tables with multiple rows and columns.
This table is equipped with features such as sorting, selection, and virtualization, along with
the ability to customize cell rendering. It's crafted to offer both high customization
and performance.

attributes.name: checkbox-selection
attributes.description:
When false, the table won't render the selection
checkboxes for each row.

This option works only when `multiSelection` is enabled

attributes.name: client-sorting
attributes.description:
When true, the table will automatically sort the data
when the user clicks on a column header. The default is false.

Use this in case you want to sort the data yourself. The event in
this case will contains the sorting information.

attributes.name: column-headers
attributes.description: When true, the column headers are rendered, hidden otherwise.

attributes.name: deselection
attributes.description:
Set to false to prevent rows from being deselected if you hold down Ctrl
and click the row (i.e. once a row is selected, it remains selected
until another row is selected in its place).

By default the table allows deselection of rows.

attributes.name: get-row-id
attributes.description: A function or an expression to generate a row id

attributes.name: header-checkbox-selection
attributes.description: If false, a `select all` checkbox will be added to the header.

attributes.name: header-height
attributes.description: The height of the header in pixels.

attributes.name: is-row-selectable
attributes.description:
A function or an expression to be used to determine which rows
are selectable.

By default rows are selectable, so return false to make
a row un-selectable.

attributes.name: multi-select-with-click
attributes.description:
Set to true to allow multiple rows to be selected with clicks.
For example, if you click to select one row and then click to select
another row, the first row will stay selected as well.
Clicking a selected row in this mode will deselect the row.
This is useful for touch devices where Ctrl and Shift clicking is not an option.

attributes.name: overscan
attributes.description:
The number of rows to pre render beyond the visible scrolling area.
The bigger the number the slower the performance. keep this value small

attributes.name: row-height
attributes.description: The height of each row in pixels.

attributes.name: selection-mode
attributes.description: The selection mode of the table.

description.value:
A Toast is a subtle notification commonly used in modern applications.
It can be used to provide feedback about an operation or to display a system message.

A toast can contain buttons by adding `a` and `button` elements to the message's body. If
any of these elements has the `data-action="close"` attribute then it will behave as a dismiss button.

```html
<dwc-toast message="The application has new update available" opened>
  <button>Update</button>
  <button data-action="close">Later</button>
</dwc-toast>
```

attributes.name: duration
attributes.description:
The duration in milliseconds to show the toast.
After that this time is elapsed , the toast will be hidden automatically.
If the duration number is negative the toast will never close automatically

attributes.name: message
attributes.description: The toast's message.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: When true, the toast will be shown , hidden otherwise

attributes.name: placement
attributes.description: The placement of the toast

attributes.description: The theme name

description.value:
The `BBjTree<dwc-tree>` provides methods for manipulating a UI tree control.

?> **Note:** The `dwc-tree` component is used to build the [BBjFileChooser(tree) version](https://documentation.basis.cloud/BASISHelp/WebHelp/bbjobjects/Window/bbjfilechooser/bbjfilechooser.htm).

attributes.description: When true, the nodes will be connected with lines to clarify the tree structure.

attributes.name: contiguous-selection
attributes.description: When true and multi-selecting is enabled. then multiple contiguous tree nodes can be selected.

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: True to disable the tree, false to enable it.

attributes.name: editable
attributes.description: Tree nodes are not editable by default. If this property is used to set tree nodes to be editable generally, then node descriptions can be changed by using a triple-click or a click-hold-click on editable nodes to go into edit mode.
